intro: Symphorema microstylis, commonly known as the small-styled symphorema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. It prefers well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
